content.description: Start on the big undercling under the roof. Make a big move out to a crimp and climb steep crimps to a slightly chossy but juggy topout.
content.protection: Pads and spotters to corral any wild swing going for the lip jug
content.location: Top of the S-Curve area. Across from Lungfish and around the corner from Slopey Rail (V8)

content.description: This interesting problem climbs a short slab to a technical traverse left.  It is low angle but the holds are small enough to keep things interesting.  After the traverse things change style with a difficult drop down onto good holds and a few more powerful moves to gain the arete.
content.protection: A few pads, watch the landing halfway through as a fall could be awkward.  For the descent probably easiest to downclimb and jump, or downclimb and jump across to the nearby boulder.
content.location: In the higher level of the area towards the middle.  Problem faces North so you won't see it until you walk around the boulder.

content.description: Start just right of the boulder at the base and climb up making a committing smear move high above the yucca. Instead of putting your pad on the yucca, just be willing to be impaled if you fall. Let's consider nature here people.
content.location: This line is on the slab next to Mr. Freud

content.description: Neglected problem near s-curve area. Start on a high flake in the center of the scoop and climb straight up. Downclimb is to the right, you will find a flake to scramble down.
content.location: This problem is on a big boulder approaching the s-curve area. Its not far from donkey show and moonshibe roof either.

content.description: Start sitting with good crimps.  Move up and grab some kneebars to get to the obvious jug.  From here another hard move gets you to another good hold.  Now transfer to the boulder to the right and head up through better holds.
content.protection: A few pads, a thin one is nice to reduce the dab potential on the boulder behind.  Spotters help for the higher but easier finish.  A kneepad is optional.
content.location: At the far North side of the S-Curve area.  This problem is tucked in a small corridor formed by two large boulders.  Wu-Tang V10 is just across from this boulder.

content.description: Start on the left of the slab and climb up to the scoop at 2/3 height of the slab. The technical crux comes low.
content.location: This slab sits directly across from Mr. Freud.

content.description: This seldom visited area contains a few two star climbs in the V4 to V10 range.  It also contains Dave Graham's Land Before Time (V13) and a highball put up by Matt Wilder.  If the more classic areas are crowded then this might be a fun place to stop for a while.  A lot of potential exists for first ascents if you are into those things.
